Bryan Frazier  Bluefield College  May 27-30, 2015  328 - Making Notepad Work for You  Jenzabar’s Annual Meeting  May 27 - 30, 2015 Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center  Nashville, TN © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Quick Test © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     This session will focus on moving Communication Management from basic letters and emails to a truly effective tool for External and Internal Communication.  Making Notepad Work for You © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Generic letters with a simple merged address block.     Generic Emails with just a name.     Simple unreportable notes.     Non-traceable internal communication.     Single address emails.  What Constitutes “Basic” © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Breaking the rules  Why do we assume it has to be done this way?  •   We’ve been told to do it this way.  •   We’ve always done it that way.  •   We’ve never seen it done another way.  A simple change can make all the difference... © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Note: NOT ALL IDEAS ARE GOOD IDEAS  It may work for other schools but it’s still a bad idea!!! © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     All merge documents must have their own query.     All merge documents must use the same query.     Different actions can’t use the same merge document.     You can only use daily procedure for outgoing / external communication.     Etc.  What are some of the “Rules”?  Example: mapping in form builder © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Problem: Candidates have multiple email addresses but Jenzabar only has one email field.  I want to send one email to multiple addresses © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     There is only one  “Email”   field on Name_Master, but we can add multiple address codes / rows to Address_Master.     It can be mapped from Form Builder.  We can add as many email accounts as you need. © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Early attempt....     Ann Hawkins created view tables for each additional email address “code”.     Then the query used this huge compute to generate the “to” block address.  “admissions@bluefield.edu; anybodybutme@bluefield.edu; ..... ”     This worked until Word ‘2010’  How do we send one action to these addresses? © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Why not pull a row in the query for each email address?  How do we send one action to these addresses? © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     We need to hit every “*EML” email address in the address history...  Let’s take it a step farther  ...for a new account or emergency notification . © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Include specific program information     Include counselor information     Vary information by term     Personalize event dates  Make letters and emails more personal © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     We can use rules and merge fields in the actual shell document.     We can use case statements and formatting when the data file is created by the query.  2 ways to vary the merge © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     If you have special licenses or have completed special training courses, be sure to email your counselor, «preferred_name1» «last_name1», at «email_address1» to learn about the documentation needed for the possibility of earning additional credits.     If you have special licenses or have completed special training courses, be sure to email your counselor, Brenda Workman, at Bworkman@bluefield.edu to learn about the documentation needed for the possibility of earning additional credits.  2 examples in the shell document © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Adding the Counselor Info © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Adding the Counselor Info  SELECT   new_merge_id_file.id_num,  name_candidate.first_name,  name_candidate.last_name,  name_candidate.preferred_name,  name_candidate.addr_line_1,  name_candidate.email_address,  candidate.cur_prog,  candidate.cur_yr,  name_and_address_b.preferred_name as counselor_preferred,  name_and_address_b.last_name as counselor_last,  name_and_address_b.email_address as counselor_email  FROM   new_merge_id_file,  name_and_address name_candidate,  candidate,  counselor_responsiple,  name_and_address name_counselor  WHERE   ( new_merge_id_file.id_num = name_candidate.id_num ) and  ( name_candidate.id_num = candidate.id_num ) and  ( candidate.counselor_initials = counselor_responsi.counselor_initials ) and  ( counselor_responsi.id_num = name_counselor.id_num ) © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Dear Bryan,  2 examples in the shell document © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Use a rule to vary  •   The body of the document  •   A paragraph  •   The enclosures  •   Images     Signature blocks can be varied specific to a counselor, BUT I do not suggest it. Key lines are in red  SELECT new_merge_id_file.id_num,  name_master.last_name,  name_master.first_name,  name_master.middle_name,  name_master.email_address,  address_master.addr_line_1,  address_master.addr_line_2,  address_master.city,  address_master.state,  address_master.zip,  address_master.country,  count(items.action_code) as Email_Count,  FROM new_merge_id_file,  name_master,  address_master,  items  WHERE ( new_merge_id_file.id_num = name_master.id_num ) and  ( name_master.id_num = address_master.id_num ) and  ( name_master.current_address = address_master.addr_cde ) and  ( name_master.id_num = items.id_number ) and  ( ( items.action_code = 'TSPOT' ) ) © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     What if we could make a flat file with out creating a table?  •   Missing Requirements letter / email.  •   Scholarship notification.  •   Etc.  Take it a step farther © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Use a Case Statement  select   NAME_AND_ADDRESS.ID_NUM,  case when NAME_AND_ADDRESS.ID_NUM IN  (select REQUIREMENTS.ID_NUM  from   REQUIREMENTS  where   candidate.ID_NUM = REQUIREMENTS.ID_NUM  and candidate.CUR_YR = REQUIREMENTS.YR_CDE  and candidate.CUR_TRM = requirements.TRM_CDE  and REQUIREMENTS.REQ_CDE = 'HSTRA'  and REQUIREMENTS.COMPLETION_STS = 'I')  then (select Top 1 REQUIREMENTS.REQ_DESC  from   REQUIREMENTS  where   candidate.ID_NUM = REQUIREMENTS.ID_NUM  and candidate.CUR_YR = REQUIREMENTS.YR_CDE  and candidate.CUR_TRM = requirements.TRM_CDE  and REQUIREMENTS.REQ_CDE = 'HSTRA'  and REQUIREMENTS.COMPLETION_STS = 'I')  else NULL end as 'HS_TRANSCRIPT'  from   NAME_AND_ADDRESS,  candidate  where   name_and_address.id_num = candidate.ID_NUM  and NAME_AND_ADDRESS.ID_NUM in ('86306','999111111') © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Use a Case Statement  case when NAME_AND_ADDRESS.ID_NUM IN  (select REQUIREMENTS.ID_NUM  from   REQUIREMENTS  where   candidate.ID_NUM = REQUIREMENTS.ID_NUM  and candidate.CUR_YR = REQUIREMENTS.YR_CDE  and candidate.CUR_TRM = requirements.TRM_CDE  and REQUIREMENTS.REQ_CDE = 'HSTRA'  and REQUIREMENTS.COMPLETION_STS = 'I')  then (select Top 1 REQUIREMENTS.REQ_DESC  from   REQUIREMENTS  where   candidate.ID_NUM = REQUIREMENTS.ID_NUM  and candidate.CUR_YR = REQUIREMENTS.YR_CDE  and candidate.CUR_TRM = requirements.TRM_CDE  and REQUIREMENTS.REQ_CDE = 'HSTRA'  and REQUIREMENTS.COMPLETION_STS = 'I')  else NULL end as 'HS_TRANSCRIPT' © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc. New Process  SELECT DISTINCT name_and_address.id_num,  name_and_address.first_name,  name_and_address.middle_name,  name_and_address.last_name,  candidate.cur_yr,  candidate.cur_trm,  candidate.cur_dept,  candidate.cur_prog,  program_def.prog_desc,  year_def.yr_desc,  term_def.trm_desc,  department.dept_desc,  'academics@bluefield.edu' as 'VPAA EMAIL ADDRESS',  'bccentral@bluefield.edu' as 'VPFIN_BC CENTRAL EMAIL ADDRESS',  'dtaylor@bluefield.edu' as 'VPSTU EMAIL ADDRESS'  FROM candidate LEFT OUTER JOIN department ON candidate.cur_dept = department.dept_cde,  new_merge_id_file,  name_and_address,  program_def,  year_def,  term_def  WHERE ( new_merge_id_file.id_num = name_and_address.id_num ) and  ( new_merge_id_file.id_num = candidate.id_num ) and  ( candidate.cur_prog = program_def.prog_cde ) and  ( candidate.cur_yr = year_def.yr_cde ) and  ( candidate.cur_trm = term_def.trm_cde ) © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.
